<rule id="spring-boot-to-azure-config-server-02000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <or>
                    <project>
                        <artifact artifactId="spring-cloud-config-server" groupId="org.springframework.cloud"/>
                    </project>
                    <javaclass references="org.springframework.cloud.config.server.EnableConfigServer.EnableConfigServer">
                        <location>IMPORT</location>
                    </javaclass>
                </or>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <hint category-id="information" effort="0" title="Spring Cloud Config Server found">
                    <message>
                        The application uses Spring Cloud Config Server.

                        If you are migrating to Azure Spring Apps, Config Server (Standard Tier) or Application Configuration Service (Enterprise Tier) will be hosted for you.
                        You can just configure the config server after creating an Azure Spring Apps instance
                    </message>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/developer/java/migration/migrate-spring-cloud-to-azure-spring-apps?pivots=sc-standard-tier#prepare-the-spring-cloud-config-server" title="Prepare the Spring Cloud Config server"/>
                    <tag>Spring Cloud Config</tag>
                </hint>
                <technology-tag level="INFORMATIONAL">Spring Cloud Config</technology-tag>
            </perform>
        </rule>
